sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT permissions (option?, name+)> <!ATTLIST permissions base CDATA #IMPLIED mode CDATA #REQUIRED>

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element permissions is one of the top-level operation elements. It allows you to change the permissions of a (set of) file(s) or directory(ies).
The sub-element option provides a means to pass an option to the chmod command.

note.para: Not all of the chmod options are in every implementation. Refer to the documentation for your implementation to determine what options are available.

sect2.para: The sub-element(s) name contain the name(s) of the files whose permission is to be modified. See .
The attribute base gives the name of the directory in which the command will be performed. See .
The attribute mode gives the new access mode, as used in the command chmod.

sect2.title: Examples
sect2.screen: echo Changing permissions of /usr/bin/lex to 755 chmod 755 /usr/bin/lex
